activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David H Bonnes

records.addlTxt:
9:08 AM Defendant David H Bonnes not in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for David H Bonnes.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense indicates the defendant is in custody in Lake County, IL. Makes statements on the record. Seeking a status date. 
State does not object. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David H Bonnes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for David H Bonnes. Court Reporter: Donna Moore. 
Atty Preston indicates the defendant was extradited to IL and indicates they are going to try to resolve this globally with the felony here in Racine. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:35 PM . Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David H Bonnes in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for David H Bonnes. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 

Comp evaluation received/reviewed by parties. Defendant is competent. 
Defense does not contest findings and request a status hearing. 
Defendant also agrees with findings. 
BTC:  Defendant is competent to proceed; next matter set for status.
Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Communicate with courts per competency Evaluation order, as well as appearing to the evaluation. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant David H Bonnes appeared by video, in custody, Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter for David H Bonnes appeared by video. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set. 
BTC: court orders a competency Evaluation based within the complaint.
Competency hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Competency hearing on April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial appearance on March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
